02.content:
Pick your favorite shrinking situation.

1. Oliver shrinks while waiting for Barry at Jitters, ending up shrunk on his seat as Iris West walks into the building.

2. Team Flash shrinks at Star Labs after Barry has a run in with a Metahuman that evaded capture, shortly after Felicity Smoak enters the building unaware of her friends situation.

3. After being shrunk in the field by a Metahuman that had come to Star City, Felicity brings Oliver to Caitlin Snow for help.

4. Barry shrinks after traveling to Star City for Oliver's help, soon after Thea Queen enters the room suffering from the Lazarus Pits effects. Her blood lust takes over and Barry must try to defend himself from her.
02.title: Arrow S3 / Flash S1

022.content:
*Takes place 2-3 weeks after season 1 finale*

It was a seemingly normal day in Central City, the birds were chirping, the sun was shining… another Metahuman was having a street side battle with The Flash AKA Barry Allen the fastest man alive.

The Scarlet speedster arrived on scene to fight his adversary of the day, Jennifer Smalls who until the night of particle accelerator explosion worked for Mercury Labs as a Molecular Biologist. However an explosion set of in her lab by the wave of dark matter making its way through the city caused her to hospitalized. Now her works been published by an ex co-worker inside Mercury Labs and Jennifer is out for revenge.

“Let me through Flash, I’ll squash that little maggot for steal credit for my hard work.” Jennifer raged, showing no signs of stopping in her quest for vengeance.

“I’m sorry. I can’t let you do that.” Barry said, sparks flying off his body as he prepared himself for the upcoming fight. He knew he’d have to be cautious since they haven’t had an opportunity to find out what Jennifer’s powers were.

Barry took off, racing around Jennifer several times in the hopes of getting her to show him her ability. Streaks of orange lightning followed his body as he circled the female Meta, who seemed to secrete green slime from the surface of her palms.

“Well that’s attractive.” Cisco joked, feeling safe from their headquarters inside S.T.A.R Labs.

“Barry be careful, we have no idea what that stuff could do to your body. For all we know it could be acid that will melt right through your bones.” Caitlin chimed in, attempting to prepare Barry for any potential outcome.

“Yeah, got it. Stay away from the slime.” Barry said as he continued to run around Jennifer. Meanwhile she tossed glob after glob of the green ozee in Barry’s direction hitting cars and street signs alike. A quick glance from the speedster revealed that nothing was happening, could generating this stuff be her only power or was there something more to it?

While trying to figure out the answer to this question in the back of his mind Barry let his guard down long enough for Jennifer to tag him on the shoulder, knocking him to the ground. After rolling for a few second Barry got up and turned to face off against his opponent, the only problem was that she’d mysteriously disappeared.

“I’m coming back, I have a sample of her slime on my suit. Maybe we can use it to track her somehow.” Barry suggested, running off without noticing that several cars hit by Jennifer’s ooze had disappeared completely from the side of the street.

Less than a minute had passed but Barry had already managed to make his way into the Cortex at S.T.A.R Labs where Cisco and Caitlin were waiting for him.

“Gnarly, what is this stuff?” Cisco asked, scooping some of the goop off the surface of Barry’s suit.

“Careful, we still don’t know what this is. It could be poisonous for all we know.” Caitlin announced, pulling a latex glove over her hand to collect a sample. Prompting Cisco to shake the substance off his hand.

Caitlin brought her finger under a microscope and wiped the substance onto a slide before removing the glove and tossing it inside the trash. “I’ll need to do a fully breakdown of the material but it appears to be alive, almost like her own cells are mixed into it. Her own genetic code is literally merged with the slime.” Caitlin explained before turning to Barry and Cisco who were now standing at level with her 32B cup breasts.

“Did you guys just get shorter?” Caitlin asked rhetorically, her shrinking friends looking up at her concerned face from below as she suddenly shot up in height from their perspective. Within mere moments they were standing at a height that barely reached Caitlin’s thighs. However it only took a few moments more for them to shrink even more so that Caitlin’s height appeared to rival that of a skyscraper.

“What is going on? Why are you shrinking?” Caitlin asked before coming to a horrific realization about what was causing this.

“Get that stuff off of you right now before you before you become microscopic!” Caitlin’s loud voice boomed, her body now towering over her shrunken friends who’s height failed to even rival the size of her two inch tall high heels.

Quickly Barry and Cisco started wiping the substance of themselves but the damage was done, they stopped shrinking at only an inch tall. Looking up at Caitlin who for some reason appeared to be smaller than she was just a few moments ago.

For a brief moment Barry and Cisco allowed themselves to become overjoyed by this development thinking that they must be growing back to their normal size. However a quick observation of their surrounding denied them this hope, instead they came to the harsh realization that the only other person who knew about them shrinking and could do something to reverse it was also shrinking herself.

Caitlin Snow got smaller and smaller from Barry and Cisco’s point of view, quickly approaching a size closer to their own. Finally she stopped shrinking at about an inch tall, the same size as the rest of her team.

“Oh man, we are so living out Honey I shrunk the Kids right now. I hope nobody breaks out a vacuum cleaner on us.” Cisco said, making his usual pop culture reference in an attempt to downplay the seriousness of him, Caitlin, and Barry being bug sized.

“How did this even happen, if the Metahuman I was fighting earlier had the power to shrink this how come I wasn’t shrunk back at Mercury labs?” Barry asked, looking to Caitlin for answers.

“That’s actually very simple, do you remember how I said that the gunk she shot at you possibly contained her own cells? Well her cells contract and expand at a staggering pace so It’s quite possible that she can also make objects and even people much larger than their normal size. However she probably interacts with the cells before they exit her body through her palms, that's why we were all shrunk to the same size. She was trying to make you this small but she couldn’t land a clean shot on you. That’s probably why she ran away. And the reason we all shrunk when we did was because it took time for it to seep into your suit but Cisco touched it with his bare hand, that caused you to shrink at the same time. I handled it with a glove but it must have made its way to my skin at a molecular level which is why I shrunk last.” Caitlin explained, taking a long winded breath.

“That makes sense but how do we get back to normal?” Barry asked, looking at their new surroundings.

“I’m not sure that we can get back to our normal sizes, at least not without the help of the Meta that shrunk us.”

“Hold up, your telling me I’m stuck living the bugs life on twenty four hour loop until the girl who shrunk Barry so she could most likely stomp on him like a grape under her boot decides to make nice and unshrink us?” Cisco asked.

“Yeah, with all three of us being so small there’s no way we can reverse this.” Caitlin said, pointing out that they were the brains of the operation and that Joe and Iris didn’t get all of the scientific stuff they dealt with everyday.

"Wait, do you hear that?" Barry asked, forcing his friends to stay quiet as sounds could be heard echoing.

*Click, clack, click, clack, click*

"Sounds like heels, we're not alone." Cisco stated.

"Maybe it's Iris. Maybe we can get her to notice us." Caitlin suggested.

The source of the sound got closer, yet for some reason Barry wasn't hopeful of getting help. Iris rarely wore normal heels unless she had a good reason.

As the person turned the corner it became clear to everyone that it was not Iris walking into the cortex but a very blonde, very tall Felicity Smoak.
https://i.pinimg.com/originals/87/39/f5/...

She was absolutely gigantic to the now tiny team flash who stood in her path, her heels creating powerful earthquake like vibrations as her feet met with the tiled floor beneath her. Alas Caitlin now knew what it was like for Barry and Cisco in the brief time period that they were looking up at her towering over them, it wasn't a feeling she wanted to get used to experiencing.

"Hello? Is anyone here? I hope you guys don't mind that I pop in for a little visit." Felicity announced as she made her way into the room. Her booming footsteps drawing closer to her tiny friends on the floor who remain still in fear of being squashed like a bug under the blonde IT's sole.

Soon after her feet land on either side of Barry, Caitlin, and Cisco, trapping them in-between her feet and forcing them to look directly up at her. They could glimpse underneath her skirt at her dark green panties, but couldn't make out much else from their current position.

"That's weird, usually someone's around here but the place is completely empty." Felicity said out loud, thinking that she was talking to herself.

"Barry, did you know Felicity was coming for a visit?" Caitlin asked, feeling even smaller than she actually was looking up at her friend who probably wore earrings bigger than her entire body.

"No, I'm just as shocked as you are. But at least now if we can get her attention she can help us track down the new Meta." Barry rationalized.

What happens next?

1. Felicity notices them on the floor and moves them to a higher position on a chair so she doesn't step on them accidentally, only to sit on them when Iris arrives in the lab.

2. Felicity explores the lab while Barry, Cisco, and Caitlin try to find a way to get her attention.

3. Barry suggest climbing Felicity to get her attention pointing out that there's not much they can do on the ground except being stepped on.
022.title: Felicity's Visit

0221.content:
"What are these little bugs on the floor? Usually it's so clean in here." Felicity's voice boomed, sending all three of the tiny scientists into a panic. Barry looked over at Felicity's gigantic high heel, and shuddered at the thought of how easily he could be crushed underneath the stiletto. And while being hit by lightening gave him super speed instead of killing him, he doubted there were any new super powers waiting underneath the IT girl's foot. He burst out into a run, surprised to find himself running no faster than the average person. Well, the average inch tall person anyway. Unfortunately, his sprint was quickly overtaken by a massive shadow. He looked up to see the underside of Felicity's heel hanging over him, ready to squish a bug out of existence.

Luckily, Felicity's curiosity got the better of her, and she decided to take a quick look and see exactly what kind of bug she was squishing. Needless to say, they were not what she was expecting.

"Barry! Is that you?" Felicity shrieked, shocked that the bug she almost squished was actually her tiny friend. She put her foot down gently, making sure that there were no other shrunken people in its path. "And Caitlin and Cisco too! How'd you get so small?"

Felicity waited for a response, but none came. After a few seconds, she smacked herself on the forehead, "Of course, you're too small for me to hear. Hold still, I'm going to pick you all up."

Felicity gently deposited the three shrunken people down onto the one of the wheelie chairs before crouching down in front of it to talk to them.

"What's going on guys? How'd you get so small?" Felicity asked, rather too loudly considering her face's proximity to the shrunken people. Her booming voice knocked Cisco and Barry down onto their butts, covering their ears in pain. "Oops. Sorry." She whispered.

"One of the metas from the particle accelerator explosion shrunk us with some kind of goo!" Caitlin shouted, taking charge as the one still standing. "I think it can be reversed, but I'm going to need some normal sized help."

"Oh of course I'll help you. Just let me know what you need." Felicity replied.

"Thanks Felicity. We really appreci-" Barry began, only to be suddenly interrupted by Iris's voice from the hallway: "Hey guys? Anyone here?"

Felicity panicked at the sound of Iris's arrival. She jumped to her feet, and turned to the hall where Iris's voice had come from, and wondered what she should do. She didn't have enough time to think of a real answer, only "don't show Iris the tinies" and "act natural". Unfortunately for the tiny trio, Felicity's panicked mind didn't come up with a gentle way of meeting those 2 objectives.

"FELICITY! DON'T!" Cisco screamed as the tinies saw Felicity's enormous ass descending towards them. Felicity had pushed back her skirt as she began her descent, revealing the tight white pair of panties she had squeezed her enormous ass into. It wasn't a thong or anything, but the panties had ridden up Felicity's ass quite a bit, ensuring little of their view of her ass was left to the imagination. Their screams were silenced as the gigantic booty touched down on the seat, ensuring they didn't have to imagine how heavy her ass was either.

...?

Iris entered the room only a second after Felicity settled into her seat. "Oh hey Felicity, I didn't know you were in town." Iris said. "Have you seen everyone?"

"Uhh...nope! Just me here! No one but me, since I got here til now." Felicity siad nervously, her mind much more focused on the fact that she was SITTING on the shrunken bodies of her friends. She could feel all 3 of them wiggling and squirming beneath her tremendous rear end. Clearly this was a horrible way to hide them, but she couldn't back out now. It's not like she could show Iris that she had all of her friends trapped under her ass. "I imagine they're out somewhere, far away from here. Probably relaxing somewhere. They're under a lot of pressure with superheroing and all." Felicity bit her lip in frustration, trying to stop herself from talking.

"Oh, ok then..." Iris replied, confused by Felicity's rambling answer. She decided to brush it off as typical Felicity awkwardness and push past it. "So what's new with you then?"

Felicity searched her mind for a response that was not related to the tiny people beneath her rear. What was actually new was the feeling of a tiny superhero squirming under her butt crack, while his two friends were flattened under each of her cheeks.

Of course, this was a new experience for the shrunken people as well. Caitlin was pinned beneath her right cheek, bearing the tremendous weight of the IT girl's body. She had ended up just under Felicity's panty line, ensuring that while her body was pinned under Felicity's cotton undergarments, her face was directly buried in doughy butt flesh. She thrashed her head around relentlessly in an attempt to free her face from the endless skin, trying to get some air into her lungs. With a jerk she manages to turn her head, leaving the right side of her face pressed against the chair cushion will the left side supported a wall of pale booty flesh.

Cisco's experience was quite similar to Caitlin's, though he had ended up a little closer to the blonde's butt crack, decreasing the weight bearing down on him and sparing him any face to flesh contact. Barry on the other hand, was in a whole different world. While Caitlin and Cisco were trapped under yielding boulders of ass fat, Barry was trapped in a fleshy coccoon right between her cheeks. Felicity's underwear was quite tight, and as the unfortunate soul who ended up beneath her butt crack, he found that it was deep enough in her butt that while the front of his body was pressed against the fabric of her undergarments, his sides were being squeezed by bare butt flesh. He instinctively tried to free himself by squirming, but this proved to be a mistake. It did nothing to help free the tiny speedster from his unfortunate position, but it did have the unintendeded result of tickling Felicity.

Felicity suddenly burst out laughing as a result of the ticklish feeling of Barry's hair rubbing against the inside of her ass cheek. She never would have guessed she was ticklish there, but she also had certainly never checked. Realizing she couldn't explain this behavior to Iris, she reflexively clenched her cheeks around Barry, trying to stop the squirming from continuing.

Barry screamed as the fleshy boulders squeezed themselves around him, tightening like a vice. Gorilla Grodd's grip had nothing on the tight clutching force of Felicity's buttocks. His screams went unheard by the giantess, drowned out by the planetoid sized cheeks embracing him. He squirmed to try to alert Felicity to what she was doing to him, but this only prompted tighter squeezing. Barry heard some of his ribs crack from the pressure, and quickly got the message that more squirming wasn't the answer. He stopped moving altogether, trying to remain completely still. As suddenly as they had started, Felicity's cheeks released their grip on Barry, and his superhuman healing quickly repaired the damage to his ribcage.

"Umm.... are you ok?" Iris asked, caught off guard by the sudden outburst.

"Err... Yes of course!" Felicity replied, clearly too enthusiastically, but relieved that the wriggling in her crack had stopped. "I just remembered a funny joke Barry told me."

"Oh ok." Iris said, mildly relieved. "What was it?"

Felicity almost smacked herself for walking into such an obvious dead end. She quickly scrambled to come up with a joke, but the only thing she could come up with was "Did you hear the one about blonde who sat on her three shrunken friends?", and she certainly wasn't going to say that. Finally, after 30 seconds of nervous silence, Felicity said "It's really all about the delivery. I think you should probably just ask Barry later."

"That's ok." Iris said, still bit unnerved by Felicity's frantic behavior. "Anyway, since the others are gone, maybe we should catch up? How about we head to Jitters? Coffee's on me."

Felicity paused to think. It took a bit longer to think with the constant distraction of three tiny people squirming against her butt cheeks, but she pushed past that. She didn't want to make Iris suspicious by saying no, given that she was just sitting around doing nothing (other than squashing their friends under her butt). But she also wanted to get rid of her as soon as possible so she could get on to helping the tiny trio.

What happens?

1. Felicity leaves to get coffee with Iris, quickly brushing the tinies off her seat and into her purse as she does so. Only after a few steps does she realize that Barry is still in her butt crack.

2. Felicity stands up to walk out with Iris, but Iris decides she needs to check something on computer quick and sits down on top of the tiny trio herself.

3. Felicity makes up an excuse and sends Iris away, and quickly stands up to apologize to the tinies as soon as she leaves.
0221.title: Under Smoak

02211.content:
"Sounds like fun. Just let me grab my purse, and I'll meet you by the elevator." Felicity answered, unable to come up with any believable lie under pressure.

However, as her tiny friends could attest coming up with a white lie had nothing on Felicity's ass in terms of pressure. Her weight was suffocating, and the size of her backside was simply massive to behold.

She brought a whole new meaning to the term *gluteus maximus*.

"Sure, I'll see you over there," Iris said as she exited the Cortex.

Felicity was quick to act after Iris made her exit, standing up and rushing to gather her things so her friend would not grow suspicious. Leaving Cisco and Caitlin gasping for fresh air on her seat in the crater-like indent left behind by her massive derriere. However, it wasn't long before Felicity appeared over them for a second time.

"Sorry," Felicity whispered, bringing her purse to the edge of her previously occupied chair. Not bothering to double check, and see if all her tiny friends were safe and accounted for before sweeping them into her purse.

The tiny scientists could hardly voice their objections before they found themselves in a freefall over the seemingly black abyss of Felicity's purse. Cisco fell onto an opened package of Mentos, while Caitlin found herself trapped between the plastic bristles of Felicity's hairbrush.

The bag swung from left too right as Felicity raced out of the cortex into the hallway, looking into her purse to make sure the tiny people were okay. "Sorry, are you guy's okay?" she asked, feeling guilty of abusing her friends.

"Well, I'm alive. Somehow!" Cisco answered, feeling exasperated with everything that was happening. "Cisco, I'm kinda stuck over here. Can you help me out?" Caitlin asked, sounding no more pleased than her friend. But what caught Felicity's attention was what she wasn't hearing, someone was missing.

"Wait, where's Barry?" she asked Cisco and Caitlin, before realizing that she could still somewhat feel him wedged between her buttcheeks.

In any other situation, Felicity would've stopped dead in her tracks and gotten Barry away from her butt before he got hurt. But she'd just turned the corner and was in full view of Iris, who was waiting for her by the elevator. She couldn't just stop and pull a one inch tall Barry out of her ass in front of his childhood friend without some form of explanation.

"Felicity!" Barry yelled, hanging off Felicity's panties, hidden by her skirt but forced to watch the ground move as she walked.

"Got everything you need?" asked Iris, sensing that something was amiss.

"Yeah, I'm pretty sure," Felicity responded, boarding the elevator with Iris.

"Plus some additional accessories," Felicity whispered to herself.

"What was that?" Iris asked.

"Oh, nothing. Just making a mental note about a small situation, I can take care of it later."

"Okay, well let's get going then," Iris said, pushing the button to take them to the top floor.

022111.title: Accidental pASSanger: Part 2

024.content:
Barry Allen has not been a superhero for very long, but he already loved it. Speeding around Central City, stopping metas, running on water, all of it had been amazing so far. But occasionally, he found himself in a situation in which he needed to consult with someone a bit more experienced. Fortunately, he was friends with Oliver Queen, the Arrow.

Without thinking much of it, Barry decided to zip over to Central City to see if Oliver was around to talk. He didn't bother with his Flash suit, figuring he would only stand out in Star City dressed in bright red leather. Instead, he ran over in his normal clothes, planning on checking a few common spots in Star City where he knew he was likely to find Oliver. The Arrow Cave and Verdant were his first stops, but were completely empty. Next on the list was a high rise apartment uptown. It technically belonged to Oliver's younger sister Thea, but he had never had the opportunity to meet her himself. That was about to change.

Unfortunately, what neither Barry nor Thea realized is that Thea's father Malcolm had installed a little bit of extra security on Thea's apartment for dealing with threats from the League of Assassins. As Barry sped up the stairs and into the apartment, Malcolm's security system sprung into action, firing a precision aimed laser right at the speedster right as he moved through the doorway.

The inch tall speedster came to a hard stop as he crashed into a pillar of pale flesh. He bounced off the barrier and fell backwards to the floor in a slump. "What was that beam? What happened?" Barry asked aloud, used to have other voices in his head through his coms. However, since he was not wearing his flash suit, he was only talking to himself.

Barry's internal wondering about how exactly he'd shrunk was interrupted as he saw the pillar he had collided with begin to move. It lifted into the air and spun around, revealing the giant, pedicured foot attached to the bottom of it. As Barry's eyes drifted upwards, he found himself looking up a giant brunette woman, who he suspected was Oliver's sister Thea. And just as he was looking up at her, her brown eyes were staring down at him. He was relieved to have been seen, though he hoped that she recognized him as a shrunken person rather than mistaking him for an insect. He was surprised to see a smile appear on her lips before she began to extend her hand down towards him.

Barry didn't know why she was reaching for him, but his instincts told him to run as the giant hand approached. He was running no faster than a normal person would, and at only an inch tall, this made him very easy to catch. "Well how did you get in here?" Thea said with a cruel smirk, dangling the tiny man between her fingers by her grip on his head. "You certainly picked the wrong girl to visit."

Barry was shocked by Thea's reaction, since this was not at all what he'd expected. He hadn't ever met her directly, but based on what he'd heard from Oliver, he'd assumed Thea would be kind enough to help him in his time of need.

"What's going on Thea? I need your help! I'm one of Oliver's friends!" Barry yelled.

"Let me show you. Wanna make sure it works before I explain too much." They said, lowering the tiny speedster back down to the cold hardwood floor of her apartment and depositing him on the ground.

Barry was confused what Thea's intentions were, but any confusion was eliminated by the sight of her bare right foot swinging into vision above, toes wiggling excitedly. "Wait! Thea Don-"

FWOMP

Her foot came down on the man far too fast for a powerless man to dodge. Her splayed toes wrapped around his neck as the ball of her foot struck him square in the chest, pinning him to the ground beneath her pale slightly sweaty sole.

"Oh yeah, this is gonna work well." Thea said with a smirk, feeling the tiny squirms of the shrunken man beneath her sole.

"Well little bug, it's kind of a long story, but what's important is that I nearly died, but was brought back to life with magic. Only problem is that the magic has 'bloodlust' has a side effect. "You're small enough that I can take you with me anywhere. I can keep you trapped in my clothes, or in my boot under my foot, or wherever else I want. And by constantly torturing you, I'll be able to keep my bloodlust under control."

Barry couldn't believe what he was hearing. He was sure Thea would help him when she found him shrunken, but instead she planned on torturing him 24/7 to keep her murderous desires in check. He needed to get away from this girl, and fast, but he was powerless. His speed had stopped working at his tiny size, and he travelled here without his suit, so he didn't have coms available to contact the team. They had no way of tracking him, and no matter how hard they looked for him, they'd likely never think to check between Oliver's little sister's toes. He could become this crazy girl's insole for the rest of his life.

"You can't do this Thea! Please bring me to Oliver! I'm the Fla-" Barry began, only to be interrupted by Thea grabbing him off the floor once more as she prepared to begin his life of torture.

033.content:
It was a classic team-up between heroes, Team Flash and Team Arrow coming together once again to stop a rouge Metahuman that had recently made his way through the newly named Star City.

Team Arrow had grown to be a group of 4 members, Oliver Queen, John Diggle, and of course, Felicity Smoak, who was assisting the two teams over comms from Star Labs. Thea Queen was left to defend Star City by herself for the day.

Team Flash was still small, however, relying solely on Barry to do most of the hard work, joined in the field by Cisco Ramon, Joe west, and the Harrison Wells of Earth-2 joining the fray. Back at Star Labs, Iris West and Caitlin Snow also assisted over comms, providing background information, and creating a strategy for the two teams.

In the middle of an encounter with the villain, Oliver and his team were pinned down behind an upside-down car. With everyone besides Barry from Team Flash taking cover behind the Star Labs van, the speedster running interference to draw the Metahuman's fire.

"Barry talk to me, what's his power?" Caitlin asked over comms, while Barry continued to run circles around the mysterious Meta. White beams flowed out of his fists, hitting stop signs, street lamps, trees, and a mailbox. All of which seemed to disappear in the blink of an eye.

"He seems to be destroying things at a molecular level, everything he zaps is disappearing entirely," Barry answers, slowing down and speeding up to better control his opponent's aim and stop him from hitting anything more vital like buildings or his teammates.

"Barry, that's impossible, you can't destroy matter. Only change it somehow, or move it from place to place. He has to be doing one or the other." Caitlin responded, prompting Cisco and Joe to prepare The Boot, charging the device for the takedown.

Unable to hit Barry, the Meta turned his attention to Barry's team, shooting two beams from his forearms at the overturned car and Van, making both disappear instantly, leaving both groups without cover. "Say goodbye to your friends, Flash!" he yelled, thrusting both arms forward.

Oliver drew his bow and fired an explosive arrow between the two beams at the Meta's feet, noticing something on the ground where the car had been out the corner of his eye, it looked like a Hot Wheels version of the car he was just hiding behind. That's when it hit him, looking back up to see Barry racing towards them, trying to use his own body as a shield.

"Barry, wait!" Oliver yelled, discovering the Meta's ability too late as the widespread beam passed through them all, his explosive arrow going off a second later. *boom* the Meta flew back out of sight and both Team Flash, and Team Arrow were affected by the Metahuman's power.

Cisco felt up and down his body, oh thank god. I'm alive, I mean we're alive. Focused on only himself and the others. However, some were already starting to see the bigger picture after coming to the same conclusion Oliver came to earlier. They'd been shrunk!

"Guys, what's going on out there? We're reading some weird telemetry back from Barry's suit, is everyone okay?" Iris asked, jumping in front of Caitlin to check-in on everyone including Barry and her dad. Everyone else still reeling after being shrunk down was surprised to discover that all of their equipment still worked just fine.

"Oh hey Iris, thanks for asking. We're all pretty much okay over here, no physical injuries at least, but there is one problem. We're all an inch tall!" Cisco yelled sarcastically into the mic, causing reverberations and feedback.

"Seriously?" Caitlin asked, amazed by the scientific element of reducing matter to such a tiny size. Not to mention, working on live subjects without any complications.

"So Barry and Oliver are..." Iris started, unsure of how to put the term delicately.

"... the size of Tic Tacs!" Felicity finished, bluntly saying what all the girls were thinking.

"Not helping!" Cisco responded, not wanting to be compared to the tiny mint at his current size. The thought of being tossed around in Caitlin's mouth like a snack, or being sat on by Iris and Felicity sending a shiver down his spine.

"You're right, sorry. Where are you guys? I'll come by and pick you up, literally I guess. Can you see the Star Labs van? There's a tracking device inside, if you get in and drive somewhere safe, I should be able to find you pretty easily." Caitlin announced, grabbing her jacket and purse.

"Yes, I can see the Van, it's right..." Cisco paused a rhythmic earthquake shook the ground, they weren't very powerful. But were strong enough to be felt at their tiny size. "Caitlin, are you guys reading any earthquakes?" Cisco asked.

"No, all sectors appear to be free of all seismic activity. Why?" Caitlin asked, curious as to why Cisco would ask so suddenly about something seemingly unrelated to their current predicament.

"Oh, cause I'm pretty sure one is heading straight towards us!" Cisco said, panicking.

"I think those are footsteps, quick everyone get to the van!" Diggle said, putting his years as a private bodyguard to use as he leads everyone in an orderly fashion, thinking that the Meta from earlier was coming back to finish the job.

But just as everyone got within a few feet of the Van a brown boot came down, and quickly transformed their vehicle into a piece of scrap metal that was as flat as a pancake. But what was more surprising to the group was the boot's owner, following the massive pillar up to the face of a young blonde-haired woman in a police uniform.

"Hello, this is officer Patty Spivot with the Anti-Metahuman Task Force. Joe, do you read me?" Patty said into her radio, causing everyone to turn towards Joe.

"Did you call her here, just jut crushed our ride? I loved that van." Cisco asked the tiny group standing frozen as Patty surveyed the overhead, only one more step away from possibly having 6 tiny bloodstains on the bottoms of her boots.

"No, I don't know how she got here so fast, she always seems to do this somehow," Joe responded, taking the radio off his belt, wondering if they should try to contact her or risk fleeing while she investigates.

"Guys Joe is right, she would have found this crime scene one way or the other, but right now we need help and Caitlin's over a 20-minute drive away. We can trust her, she's my girlfriend." Barry said, the news coming to a shock to Oliver and Diggle that Barry was dating this giant woman, though they doubted she would be very tall at all standing at their normal height.

"Call her," Oliver said, willing to risk her finding out his secret identity if Barry trusted her.

"Officer Spivot, come in. Maintain position and look down on the ground in front of your feet." Joe said over the radio, causing a confused Patty to look down at what appeared to be a group of little bugs.

"Is this a prank Joe? Why are you telling me to look at these insects when there's a crime scene all around me?" Patty asked, leaning down to see that the bugs were acting kinda funny.

"Insects? Do we look like insects to you?" Cisco asked, grabbing the radio to talk to Patty. Her face conforming to shock as the realization dawned on her, bending down closer to see that each 'bug' as she referred to them as earlier actually had a human body, they were just miniaturized.

Patty laughed nervously and responded to Cisco's hypothetical question with an honest answer "I mean, kinda. You can't blame me when you're all so tiny." defending herself. "I suppose the Metahuman that was here did this to you guys, they must have the power to condense matter into a single point, drawing in all your body mass to make you shrink. The only question is how we can reverse this?" Patty asked, inserting herself into Team Flash's business.

"Wait, we can handle this ourselves. We have friends that can help us return to normal, we just need to get to them first." Barry said, still hiding his secret identity for now, not that Patty would be able to see his face while she was still towering over them.

"And how do you plan on getting back to them without my help? Either let me help throughout the whole process, or you can find your way home yourselves." Patty announced, stating a rather bold stance on the problem at hand. Not giving them much of a choice in the matter when considering their other options.

"Caitlin, stay put, we've got a new ride home," Barry said over comms. "Okay officer Spivot, you win. But first, we need you to take us back to our friends, you can work with them to restore us to our normal size." Barry continued, speaking over the radio to Patty, discussing his voice by vibrating his throat muscles. Still, there was something oddly familiar about it that the giant police officer couldn't quite put her finger on, but she did already have her suspicions that it was someone she knew.

"Okay, so where are we going?" Asked Patty, thinking of a way to carry six inch tall people back to her squad car around the corner without raising suspicion from anyone that saw her. Pulling out an evidence collection bag from her chest pocket.

"Oh, you've got to be kidding me," Diggle said, not liking the idea of being carried around like trail mix in the giant blonde's breast pocket.

"Okay everyone, get in." Patty smiled awkwardly, bending down and opening the bag in front of them, using her free hand to herd them inside one by one before sealing it mostly shut, leaving a small opening for air, but closing it enough so that they couldn't get out.

"Take us to Star Labs," Joe said as Patty lifted the bag to her face, looking at the tiny people inside before smiling at the tiny Flash, certain that she knew who was inside the red spandex suit. Folding the back once over itself and placing them inside of her left chest pocket for transport...
033.title: Tiny Troubles with Patty Spivot

052.title: Arrow S6 / Flash S4 / LOT S3 / Supergirl S3

0521.content:
Drawf Star Alloy was particularly strong and powerful element, a small piece of the black metal the size of a finger was enough to power Ray Palmer's Exosuit for years or even decades to come. Last year, during a trip to the wild west in 1874 the Legends discovered a deposit of Dwarf Star twenty times larger. Since then Ray has managed to fashion himself a new A.T.O.M Exosuit and created other new inventions like the shrink ray or hyper molecular compressor as Ray would call it.

Now with their upcoming battle against the demon Malice, Sara has finally given Ray the okay to help upgrade the Waverider with his technical expertise. However, she's asked that the newest member of the Legends Zari Tomaz do the actual installation as the mechanic of the ship, with assistance from Gideon.

"Damn, why is this stuff so heavy? Zari complained as she moved the final fragment of Dwarf Star into its container before turning around to type in a few lines of code on a nearby keyboard.

"You really shouldn't be so surprised miss Tomaz. Among all known elements Dwarf Star is believed to be the densest material in the entire universe," said Gideon, the ships artificial intelligence. Responding to Zari's earlier question.

"Yeah, maybe after whatever's rattling around inside Mick Rory's skull." Zari cracked, finishing off what she believed to be a successful update that would allow Gideon's systems to interact with the Dwarf Star Alloy.

"Okay Sara, we're all set," Zari said, speaking to her captain over the ship's intercom. With that announcement, she exited the engine room, sealing the bulkhead doors behind her.

"Okay guys, let's get this freakshow rounded up so we can hit the road. Gideon has detected an anachronism in the year 1928, Amelia Earhart's plane was just torn apart by King Clovis and Salian Franks tribesmen." Sara said, alerting her crew of their next time jump.

"Who cares, all I need to know is where I can go to get a drink," Mick says, focused more on getting drunk then protecting history.

"You can't get drunk, it's during the prohibition. It's illegal to get drunk." Ray Palmer answers back, looking to keep Mick out of trouble with the lawmen of the past.

"Technically speaking, alcohol was banned throughout the entirety of the roaring twenties. But it was hardly difficult to get your hands on, by the late 1920's they had speakeasies set up blocks apart from one another. With the right historical data, I could help you find any number of establishments that serve alcohol." Nate Hardwood interjects, strapping himself in for the coming time jump.

"Haha, looks like your my new drinking buddy metal man." Mick laughs, strapping himself in as well.

"You heard them Gideon take us to 1928," Sara says, setting the coordinates.

"Understood, Captain Lannnnn." Gideon began before crashing, the light on board the Waverider going dark. Power soon faded, the engines of the ship stopped pushing the Legends through time. They could feel the ship cruise towards the curved walls of the timestream, the crew bracing themselves for impact.

"What the hell is going on‽," Asked Zari as she forced her way through the mechanical door with the help of Amaya's animalistic strength.

"Strap yourself in or grab onto something, we're crashing in time!" Sara exclaimed. Amaya, using her totem to boost her speed was able to get to her seat in time and strap herself in. Zari, on the other hand, whipped up winds using her own totem to propel her to the wall where she quickly grabbed onto something sturdy that could support her.

"You're joking! We can't actually crash in time, right?" Zari asked, concerned by Sara's words. Suddenly the ship ran adrift into a wall of cascading energy, a loud bang filling the hull.

"Does it feel like I'm joking!" Sara yelled as the ship fell outside the timestream. Their exit point was a park located in the center of National City on Earth 38, the vibrations caused by their Timeship hitting the cascading wall strong enough to open a breach between worlds. However, without the proper amount of speed and force usually required to travel between worlds, the rift it produced wasn't very large. In fact, it was barely large enough for one person to squeeze through if that.

The Legends ship exited from the breach, approximately being the size of a basketball. Smoke billowed from the engines as the ship quickly plumed from the sky, or at least six free of the ground. The Waverider was being driven to the ground, and its passengers all knew what was going to happen next.

"Brace for impact!" Sara yelled just before the ship made a terrific crash landing on the grass of the park. They nosedived through the dirt, carving out a path a few feet long in length before coming to a complete stop. However, the Legends problems didn't stop there, more accurately they'd only just begun.

"Ugh, is everybody alright?" Sara asked, checking on the condition of her crew before worrying about the damage done to the ship.

"What happened?" Nate asked, being the first person to get his bearings after the crash, one of the benefits to being made of steel.

"Ow, best guess. The Dwarf Star overloaded Gideon's circuits, forcing her to shut down until we figure out a way to get the ship up and running again." Zari suggested, unsettling some members of the Legends.

"Way to go Haircut. We've got ourselves in a real mess now." Mick said casually, seeming more or less unaffected by the crash.

"What? There's no way, my calculations were precise down to the last decimal." Ray said, feeling the need to defend himself from Mr. Rory's comment.

"Guy's arguing about this is pointless, let's just figure out where or when we've landed," Amaya interjects, bringing the discussion of how they crashed to a close.

The Legends came to gather in front of the Waverider's front windshield, their view blocked out entire by the black smoke coming off their ship.

*Boom* *Boom*

"What the hell was that?" Asked Wally West, who'd remained silent up till that moment.

"Sounded like a loud bang to me, do you think something blew up on the ship?" Amaya followed, asking a question of her own.

"If it was we wouldn't be standing here, trust me," Zari commented, having some recent experience with an exploding Waverider herself.

*Boom, Boom* *Boom, Boom*

This time the tremors vibrated at a deeper frequency, causing the Waverider to shake as a result. Not only that but they had doubled, two larger quakes, followed by two slightly smaller ones. It was at that moment Ray realized what was going on.

"Um, guys. I don't know how to tell you this, but we've um..." Ray paused recalling the first tests he ran on the A.T.O.M Exosuit after escaping Damien Darhk. Then suddenly an extremely tall leather boot touched down in front of the Waverider, traveling up no less than a hundred feet to a woman's knee.

"...shrunk," Ray said, finishing his earlier statement as the smoke began to clear.

"There's no way, it couldn't possibly be," Said a familiar voice, most familiar to the ship's captain Sara Lance. Funny, she had the exact same thought as the smoke cleared to confirm both women's suspicions as Sara found herself looking up at a massively gigantic Alex Danvers, accompanied by a younger teenage girl named Ruby

Most confused by this turn of events was Ruby, at first glance she simply thought the Waverider was just some kind of weird looking drone or some toy. She couldn't tell why Alex was taking such an interest in it, or even that there were tiny living people inside of it.

"Alex, what is that thing?" Ruby asked, thinking it looked almost like a flying saucer. Although, it was much smaller than the ones she'd seen on television. We're there even aliens that tiny that could ride in such a ship, it was no bigger than a basketball. She could pick it up with ease, having thoughts of stopping an entire alien invasion by herself. Swatting down their fleet one ship after another and crushing the Aliens inside under her sneakers, imagining how power she would be compared to such a puny species of bug-sized aliens. She could then be like the woman she admired most of all, Supergirl.

With Ruby deep in thought, Alex had a moment to decide how she was going to deal with this turn of events? Does she decide to introduce Ruby to the Legends or keep them a secret from the young girl? She had to make a decision quickly.

1. Alex takes to long and Ruby asks Alex again what the object in front of them in, walking up to it herself to get a better look and forcing Alex's hand to tell Ruby what's really going on.

2. Alex knows Ruby is too smart to be lied to for long. Instead, she tells her that the device in front of them is part of a military project at her job and she must return it to them. Bringing the Waverider to Kara so she can get it into the hands of Supergirl.

3. Alex doesn't say anything to Ruby about what the strange ship actually is and instead picks it up, bringing the Legends home with them to her apartment. Alex tells Ruby she can go into the freezer and eat as much Ice Cream as she wants, putting the Waverider on her bed before making a call to Kara to tell her whats going on. However, things take a wrong turn when Sara authorizes a team of Legends to go out in the Jump Ship for help.
