05213.content:
"Don't worry about it Ruby, I'll take care of it. I am pretty sure I know the owner" Alex said, lifting up the ship and bringing it up to her face to take a closer look at it. Her enormous eye stared into the window, but it was hard to make out details of the inside, as the windows were quite small. She thought she could see some tiny people inside, which was enough to at least partially validate her suspicions that this was the real Waverider. And if she was right, the owner she was looking for, the tiny Sara Lance, was between her palms.

"Oooookaaaaay...." Ruby replied skeptically, feeling like Alex was hiding something from her. What was this thing anyway? It looked like a toy, but then why would Alex recognize it? Maybe she was right and it was aliens? But then why would they be so tiny?

Choosing to push past Ruby's obvious doubts, Alex began walking back to the apartment, Waverider clasped against her chest.

For the shrunken Legends, this was not a casual walk. Alex did her best to hold the ship steady, but as she walked the ship naturally bounced and moved side to side in her hands. And while this was so minor that she barely noticed it, the shrunken Legends certainly felt what was happening.

"Hold on to something!" Sara yelled, holding tightly to her captain's chair. The rest of the tiny team did not have her impressive assassin reflexes, and as such did not react quickly enough to do avoid being thrown about. Ray clumsily banged his head, immediately passing out. An already mildly drunk Mick toppled over into the wall, cursing all the while. Amaya and Nate both reached for each other, but neither remembered to brace against anything solid and so they were thrown across the room into the library, landing in a pile of dislodged books. Wally was fast enough to buckle himself into one of the other seats, avoid the brunt of the shaking. Zari managed to deflect any flying objects with her wind powers, and kept herself floating in the air to avoid the shaky floor.

Luckily for the Legends, Alex's apartment wasn't too far away. After they walked into Alex's apartment, Ruby once again brought up the shrunken spaceship, which had been occupying her mind for the whole walk. "What are you going to do with that Alex?" Ruby asked, still wondering why Alex was acting so weird about all of this.

"Don't worry about it Ruby. I'm just going to try and contact the owner to let them know we have it is all." Alex said, still worrying that Ruby was not buying her lame lies. "Why don't you leave this to me and go have some ice cream? I have plenty in the fridge, and you can have as much as you like."

This was enough to get the teen girl to drop any lingering worries about the ship. She quickly thanked Alex and turned on her heels, running back to the kitchen to begin preparing her dessert.

Relieved, Alex walked into her room and gingerly placed the ship down on her bed. She paced around her bed, examining it as she wondered what to do.

Meanwhile, the Legends were just sitting in the control room watching as the gigantic Alex moved about, her tremendous body looming over their shrunken home. Finally, the gigantic brunette shook her head and stepped out of the bedroom, closing the door behind her.

"What's going on Sara? How come Alex isn't acknowledging us?" Zari asked.

"I don't know... It does seem odd..." Sara said, the gears in her head turning.

"Maybe she doesn't think it's really us?" Ray suggested. "Perhaps she thinks the tiny ship is some kind of trick or trap?"

"Maybe, but then why would she bring us home with her?" Sara replied.

"Maybe it has something to do with the little brat with her." Mick grumbled, not showing any concern about their situation as he popped open a beer.

Sara sat in thought for a moment as everyone looked to her for orders. It was up to her to make the right call. What did she decide to do?

1. Sara decides to send some of the team out in a jump ship to try to see what Alex is planning.

2. Before she can make a decision, Ruby comes into Alex's room and grabs the ship, wanting to figure out what it was
05213.title: Alex Brings the Legends Home

052131.content:
"Alright, well I say we stop guessing and find out for ourselves." Sara interrupted, getting the undivided attention of everyone in the room. "Let's send a small team out in the jump ship to investigate what Alex is doing. No making contact, just a reconnaissance mission. Any volunteers?"

"I'll go. My enhanced sight and hearing could be useful." Amaya volunteered.

"I'll go too!" Nate said, a little too loud. He was going to take any opportunity he could get to spend time with Amaya.

"Wally, could you tag along and keep an eye on the lovebirds?" Sara teased, causing Nate and Amaya to look away from one another as their faces flushed red.

"Aye aye captain." Wally said, and the three of them headed out towards the jump ship. Amaya and Nate took the two front seats next to each other, while Wally took a seat in the back, already feeling like he was third wheeling.

They managed to take off in the jump ship without too much trouble. The ship didn't seem to be moving very fast at its reduced size, taking them a full minute just to cross from Alex's bed to her bedroom door. Fortunately, the giant DEO agent had not closed the door all the way, leaving a crack for the tiny jump ship to squeeze through. Out in the hall, they came to a fork. Looking to the right, they saw the gigantic Ruby preparing herself an ice cream sundae. A silent look between the crew members was enough to agree that that was the wrong direction. Looking left, they saw Alex disappear into her guest room at the end of the hall.

The flight over to Alex was uneventful, arriving in the room just in time to overhear the tail end of a phone call.

"Yeah Kara I know it sounds ridiculous but I think this is the real deal. We could really use your super hearing and vision right about now." Alex said, tapping her foot impatiently as she talked to her sister. She knew what she had seen, and leaving it unattended in her room was making her nervous. "Alright thanks sis. See you soon."

"Sounds like we've got nothing to worry about." Wally said. "Supergirl will be here soon, and she'll be able to see and talk to us."

Relieved, the tiny trio turned the jump ship around and headed back out into the hall. All they had to do now was let Sara and the rest of the team know that they were in the clear. What could go wrong?

"Nate watch out! It's the girl from before!" Amaya said, pointing at the giant Ruby who was currently walking right towards them.

"Don't worry Amaya. She's just a little girl. We're just going to fly right past her." Nate said, his voice full of confidence. He was much more worried about impressing Amaya than about some kid, even if she was giant.

"Gross, how did a fly get in here." Ruby muttered, noticing the tiny flying ship out of the corner of her eye.

"Nate... she sees us..." Amaya said, growing very worried as the gigantic eyes of the girl stared directly at them.

"She's a little girl, she's probably afraid of bugs." Nate said, trying to sound confident despite his growing fear.

"I don't think so man." Wally replied, pointing towards Ruby's raised hand.

"Evasive maneuvers! Hang on!" Nate yelled, grabbing the flight stick and pushing it forward, sending the ship into nose dive. The ship shuddered from the shock wave of her hand swiping behind them, only barely missing the tail of the ship.

"Pull up Nate!" Amaya screamed, more willing to take their chances with a giant teenager than to crash at maximum speed into Alex's hardwood floors.

Nate pulled back on the stick, straightening out the ship a few inches above the ground. They were at Ruby's ankle height now, near her tremendous sneaker-clad feet.

"Well, that was a close one." Nate sighed, exasperated. He had no idea that this was far from over.

"There you are bug. Time to get squished." Ruby's voice boomed above them, just before the entire ship was engulfed in shadow. Looking up, the tiny trio saw that this was due to the enormous sneaker now hanging over them, ready to crush them into the floor. At their size, they could see every speck of dirt and mud on the bottom of the giant teen's sneaker, and if they didn't move quickly they'd be mixed in with it. Wally reacted first, grabbing the controls from Nate and jerking the ship to the side. The sneaker slammed down next to them, missing them by a mere inch. The rush of air as her foot came down sent the ship rolling, throwing the tiny trio around the ship as it spun. This time Amaya was the one who regained control, grabbing the controls and straightening them out while pulling them up. They rose as they stabilized, coming to a stop right at Ruby's eye level. The gigantic eyes locked onto the ship, and the shrunken Legends could see they were full of contempt for the bug that had invaded their apartment. And she was about to end that invasion.

"Oh shit." Nate said, watching the giant palm come careening towards them. There was no time to move, only to wait for impact...

SMACK

The impact sent the tiny ship careening across the room, far faster than it was capable of traveling under its own propulsion. It only stopped when the ship struck a hard surface. The passengers were too disoriented to know if it was a wall or a ceiling but it was hard enough to shatter the ship. The sound of breaking glass and bending metal rang in their ears as Ruby's palm struck the jump ship in mid-air. The entire vessel split in half on the impact, leaving its tiny passengers in free fall as the metal shell crashed to the ground.

Nate, Amaya, and Wally all screamed as they plummeted downwards, completely out of control. They only got a brief look at where they were heading before they crashed down into...

1. Ruby's Ice Cream Sundae, just before she sat down in front of them with a spoon.

2. The couch (Amaya and Nate end up on one cushion, Wally ends up on another. Before they can get back to each other, Ruby and Alex sit down on each of them to watch some TV while they wait for Kara).

3. Alex's giant boot, just before she put them on because her feet were cold.
052131.title: Legends Loose in Alex's Apartment

choices: Kara and Alex Talk to the Legends
0521312.content:
"We're going down!" Wally yelled as the wall of the ship crumbled from the impact of Ruby's hand, leaving a gaping hole right near Amaya. She tried to activate her totem as quickly as she could, but there was no time. Faster than even Wally could run, she was sucked out of the hole into Alex's apartment.

"Amaya!" Nate yelled, diving out of the ship after her. He had no plan on how to save her, but he had to do something to help his girlfriend. He dove downwards, gaining speed and aiming directly at Amaya.

"Gotcha!" Nate shouted, wrapping his arms around her and pulling her close. While this was somewhat comforting, it did nothing to solve the main problem, which was that they were plummeting to what might be their deaths.

Meanwhile, Wally was still in the falling jumpship as it spun out, holding on as best he could. He caught a quick glimpse of Nate and Amaya together through the hole as he spun past, but the ship was growing farther from them with every passing second. Suddenly, an ear splitting CRACK echoed through the damaged ship, and the entire thing split in two like a cracked egg, dumping Wally out of the bottom.

Unaware of their tiny plight, Ruby was still looking for the fly she had swatted, hoping to finish it off once and for all with a final stomp. She was mostly focused on the apartment floor, not noticing the tiny people falling through the air now that their ship was in shambles.

"Did you lose something Ruby?" Alex asked, stepping back into the room from her call with Kara.

"Oh just trying to find a fly that was bugging me." Ruby replied, standing back up. "I swatted it down, but didn't see where it landed."

"Ugh, I hate bugs." Alex said, annoyed that one had even made it into her apartment. "Don't worry about it too much though. If you knocked it down, we'll probably end up squishing it by accident sooner or later anyway. Let's just start the movie."

This conversation echoed around the shrunken people as they continued their descent. Amaya and Nate lung to each other as they fell screaming downward toward the couch, with Wally not far behind them. The shrinking process had their powers on the fritz, preventing them from saving themselves. Amaya could not seem to find a flying animal's spirit, no matter how many times she tapped her totem. Wally had similarly bad luck with his powers, as he was unable to generate enough speed to create the necessary tornados. All he managed was a light gust past Ruby's ear as she searched for the bug, barely enough to move her hair.

Fortunately, Ruby's slap sent them spiraling towards Alex's couch, rather than the endless plains of hardwood floor that surrounded it. Nate landed first, catching Amaya against his chest. The speed of the impact sent both of them bouncing upward, ending with them laying a few feet apart, gasping for breath. Wally crashed down on the adjacent couch cushion, coming to a similar bouncing stop. He landed on his back, giving him an opportunity to see the shards of the jump ship crashing down onto the floor below. What he didn't notice was the piece that landed one cushion down from him. Fortunately, it contained the jumpship's cameras, which were now trained on the shrunken trio on the couch. This would allow everyone still onboard the Waverider to see everything that happened to them on this couch.

Amaya and Nate rolled over onto their backs, gasping as they caught their breath and the adrenaline left their systems. They had heard only bits and pieces of Alex and Ruby's conversation around them, but now they saw Alex standing before them, dominating their full attention. From their spot on the couch, they were only at about knee height to the giant secret agent. They briefly thought she had finally noticed their predicament, until they saw the most terrifying sight they'd ever seen: Alex turning around. Her beautiful face was abruptly replaced with her shapely rear end, clad in her familiar black jeans. Nate gulped at the sight, turning to Amaya to see her looking just as terrified. He hated how powerless he was, wanting desperately to spare his girlfriend the fate he knew was coming for them. "Alex wait! Don't si-" Nate began, only to have the rest of his sentence swallowed up by Alex's ass.

"Oh shit oh shit." Wally said, watching his friends get enveloped by Alex's ass. He immediately knew he had to rescue them, though he had no idea if they were even alive under there. How much weight could they stand at their new sizes? He shuddered at the thought of Alex standing up, revealing only a pair of red puddles where his friends used to be.

Alex's face scrunched up for a moment, giving Wally a brief moment of hope that she had felt them under her butt. Instead, she just said "Hmmm, this couch is lumpier than I remembered." before wiggling her butt in her seat, rolling the tiny people turned cushions back and forth under her cheeks.

Wally was so horrified by where he was seeing that he wasn't even paying attention to the other giant in the room. He only noticed her again when he found himself covered by a shadow. Turning upward, he saw Ruby, the girl who had swatted down their ship. Or more precisely, he saw her sweat pants clad butt falling onto him.

----------

"Oof, that's gotta hurt." Zari said, watching as Wally disappeared underneath the young girl's butt. She wasn't worried about them being squished, having learned about a lot of the science of shrinking from Ray. Still, Sara wanted to confirm.

"They'll be alright, won't they Ray?" Sara asked, cringing as she watched Alex kick up her feet and Ruby squirm to get comfortable in her seat.

"Yes of course!" Ray answered enthusiastically. "Shrinking makes us very durable. In fact, when I first invented the ATOM tech, Felicity accidentally sat on me during a test run."

That was enough of a reassurance for Sara. If it was enough to survive Felicity's butt, she doubted anything could crush them.

"They deserve to get squished if they're not strong enough to stand up to some girls' asses." Mick grumbled.

"Oh yeah Mick? How about after the rest of us grow back we leave you shrunk and you join me in the Captain's seat?" Sara threatened. This was enough to shut Mick up. Sara was an assassin, she could kill you with anything, and she didn't make idle threats. In silence, the team went back to watching the footage.

> https://www.writing.com/main/interact/it... < * How Ray survived Felicity's butt.

------

Meanwhile, the three couch bound Legends were learning just how much power could be behind some giant butts. Amaya and Nate had ended up under Alex's left and right cheeks respectively, and between them they were responsible for supporting a lot of her weight. Fortunately, their superhuman abilities made them more resistant to injury. However, they were not enough to escape. Try as they might, their super strength was not enough to lift the secret agent's cheeks up off of them, or even to get back to watch other. When they tried to call out to one another, their screams disappeared into the mass of her ass cheeks. Their world was endless, monotonous butt weight, bearing down endlessly and relentlessly. Occasionally, one of them was granted a brief reprieve as Alex took a moment to readjust her weight, but this was always at the expense of the other temporarily bearing her full weight as she leaned all of her weight onto that cheek. The only plan either of them could come up was to wait and hope that Wally would come and find a way to rescue them. They had not even seen where he landed, but they were sure that wherever he was, it couldn't be worse than this.

Wally had instead ended up under Ruby's crack, right between her cheeks. And since she was wearing sweatpants, they were riding up a little bit, pulling Wally up with them. He was no longer on the couch, he was suspended over it, pinned between soft, sweatpants clad cheeks. He tried to wiggle free, both to escape this embarrassing and painful situation, and also to get to the trapped Amaya and Nate. But this proved futile. To Ruby, he was just an annoying itch, resolved by an unconscious clench of her ass cheeks. Her squeezing cheeks emptied all the air out of Wally's lungs as her cheeks became tectonic plates, squeezing the valley he was trapped in out of existence with their movements. And all the while, she had no idea of what her ass was doing to him. She was far too focused on the movie and her ice cream to notice something as inconsequential as a superhero locked in battle with her butt cheeks. As he was chewed by Ruby's ass, he was almost jealous of Nate and Amaya's plight. He'd much rather be pinned under the butt of a hot woman like Alex than be trapped between a teenage girl's ass cheeks, even if it meant a little extra weight.

What happens next?

1. Kara arrived, and Alex takes her to the Legends ship (with Nate and Amaya stuck to her butt, and Wally still trapped under Ruby)

2. Alex and Ruby get bored of the movie, and decide to play a game of Twister instead, with the Legends still sticking to their butts (at least at the beginning of the game).

3. Ruby finally feels Wally's struggling after adjusting herself a bit, and finds the tiny man under her butt with Alex right next to her.
0521312.title: Alex and Ruby's Super Seat Cushions

05213121.content:
Alex and Ruby were so engrossed in the TV that they didn't even notice Kara had walked in until she spoke.

"Hey girls! Sorry to interrupt your movie, you both look very comfy." Kara said, unaware that they owed some of their comfort to the tiny superheros under their asses. "Alex, you said you have something you needed to show me?"

"Yeah, it's in my room, come with me." Alex said, slowly pushing up onto her feet. As Alex did so, Supergirl could swear she heard quiet gasping sounds, but she was quickly distracted by Ruby's much louder voice, leaving both girls unaware of tiny Amaya and Nate's current position.

"This is about the ship we found right? Is it from some tiny aliens?" Ruby asked, unaware one of those tiny aliens was cushioning her butt.

"No no nothing like that." Alex lied. "I think it might be a new drone from L Corp that got lost, and I am pretty sure Kara would recognize it if it is."

"Oh, well that's boring." Ruby said, twisting back to the TV (and rubbing her ass along Wally in the process).

"Let's go Kara." Alex said, walking down the hallway towards her room. As she did so, she unknowingly carried Amaya and Nate with her. The two tinies were stuck from pressure to Alex's black jeans, bouncing along with her butt cheeks with each step she took.

And with that, Ruby was alone. Or at least, she thought she was. As she sighed in frustration about being excluded, she kicked up her feet on the ottoman and settled deeper into her seat, unaware of what that was doing to the second fastest hero alive. As she sunk into her seat, there was less cushion beneath her, forcing the frame of the couch to push harder on her cheeks, squeezing them upward and inward and forcing them tightly around the tiny speedster.

Wally couldn't take this anymore. He knew he had to escape, and there was only one way to do so: he would have to try phasing. He had never been particularly good at phasing, but it was the only option if he didn't want to spend any more time under this girl's ass. If he could phase through the couch, he could end up on the floor beneath it and run back upstairs to the ship. It was a risky plan, but he had to try.

He began to vibrate, building up speed to begin to phase. Unfortunately, this was quickly felt by Ruby, who viewed a vibration under her butt in the only logical way: as an itch. Annoyed, she pressed her butt down harder against the seat, trying to eradicate it.

This could not have happened at a worse time for Wally. Just as he reached phasing frequency, her butt pressed down, now without him beneath it as an obstacle. He effortlessly vibrated right through her sweatpants and panties, leaving him in the warm darkness of her ass. When he came to a stop, he was face to face with her uncovered butt crack, a giant squishy cheek pinning him from either side.

"No no no!" Wally yelled, banging frantically on the inside of the preteen girl's butt cheeks. It was futile though. She didn't so much as acknowledge him as she watched her show, and he dared not phase again. If he got it wrong again, he ran the risk of phasing into one of them, leaving him permanently embedded in a teenage girl's ass cheek.

-----

Meanwhile, Alex and Kara we're heading towards the bedroom.

"Kara, Kara!" Kara could have sworn she heard someone calling her name. She turned back to her sister, thinking it must have been Alex, but Alex just looked at her confused. Before Alec could say anything, she heard the voices again, this time noticing they were coming from lower down.

"Don't move Alex." Kara said, shuffling around behind her sister and lowering her glasses to better use her supervision. What she saw was very surprising. "Uhhhh, Alex, I think you were right about the Legends shrinking."

"Why do you think that? You haven't even seen the ship yet?" Alex asked.

Kara kneeled down behind her sister, getting a better look at Nate and Amaya. "Well, two of them are stuck to your butt."

"What?!" Alex practically yelled, starting to turn around. Kara caught her leg with her hand to keep her sister still, not wanting to shake the tinies off.

"Just stay still Alex, I'll talk to them." Kara said, bringing her face somewhat uncomfortably close to her sister's rear. "What happened you guys? How did you get so small, and what are you doing on my sister's butt?" Kara asked.

"Just get us off of her butt and we will tell you everything!" Nate shouted.

"Of course, sorry." Kara said. "It's just that for us, something like this is a pretty typical Tuesday. Though I guess you are the first of her friends for Alex to sit on. At least, as far as we know of." Kara said with a laugh, before quickly realizing it wasn't the right time. She couldn't help it though, they were so cute at their tiny sizes, and they looked hilarious hanging off of Alex's butt. Still, she was Supergirl, and people needed her help. She gingerly plucked them off of her sister's cheeks, holding them on her palm as she stood up.

"Thanks for the assist." Amaya said, stretching her legs now that she could use them again.

"Heh, ASSist." Nate joked, but a glare from Amaya shut him up.

"I can barely hear them at all Kara, their voices are too small." Alex said, leaning in close to her sister's palms.

"What happened you guys?" Kara asked.

"The Waverider shrunk somehow and crash landed on your earth, and your sister found us and brought us home. She didn't say anything to us though so we were confused what was going on, so Nate Wally and I went out in the jump ship to investigate. That younger girl you were with thought the ship was a fly though, and swatted it down, where we crashed on the couch and got sat on." Amaya said.

"Yeah, sorry about that..." Alex said, embarrassed that she has subjected two superheros to her rear. "Wait, you said Wally was with you? Wally West? Is he stuck to my butt too?" Alex asked, glancing over her shoulder at her black jeans clad rear end.

"No, we believe he got sat on by young girl who swatted us." Amaya explained.

"Wally is under Ruby?" Alex asked, unable to believe it.

Kara couldn't help but out a tiny laugh at the thought of the tiny boy trapped under the tiny girl, but she quickly stifled it and put on a serious look under the watchful gaze of the tiny Legends. "Let me see if I can see him." Kara said, looking out towards Ruby on the couch. She lowered her glasses out of the way, focusing her X-Ray vision on the couch. When she didn't see anything on the seat of the couch where she expected, she assumed Wally must have someone gotten away. That is, until she saw a bit of movement out of the corner of her eye. Focusing there, she saw something she never expected: a tiny Wally wiggling in between Ruby's butt cheeks.

"What do you see Kara?" Sara asked, not letting her small stature detract from her position as Legends leader. "Is Wally alright?"

"Yeah he's fine..." Kara began, trying to choose her words delicately. "It's just, he... Well he... Uhhhhh.... seems to have phased through Ruby's pants and underwear."

"What? Are you saying Wally is pinned under one of Ruby's butt cheeks?" Nate asked, now feeling like Wally had definitely gotten the worse end of the deal.

"Not exactly... It's more like he is between her butt cheeks." Kara said embarrassed.

"Damn it Wally!" Nate muttered, unsure how they'd get him back without alerting Ruby.

What do they decide to do?

1. Kara and Alex decide the best course of action is to wait for Ruby to go to sleep and save Wally later. They spend the rest of the evening trying to keep Ruby from doing anything too painful for Wally.

2. Not wanting to tell Ruby about Wally, the Legends decide to attempt a rescue mission, with Amaya (given her flight and strength) volunteering to go into Ruby's pants and get Wally, while Kara and Alex keep her distracted.

3. The girls tell Ruby that she was right, they are aliens, and there's a tiny one under her butt right now (they don't want to reveal Kara's superhero nature to Ruby, so they just go with aliens).
05213121.title: Kara Finds Nate and Amaya

0523.content:
Some more scenarios:

1. Barry and Iris decide to have their honeymoon on Earth 38. But when they teleport there with Cisco's portal device, the device malfunctions, and they instead end up shrunken on the bed of a giant sleeping Kara Danvers.

2. TBD
0523.title: Arrow S6 / Flash S4 / LOT S3 / Supergirl S3 Part 2

choices: Sleepily Wedged Between the Buns of Steel
Alien Encounter on a Parallel Earth
05231.content:
"Let's go already Barry! I can't wait!" Iris said, practically jumping with excitement. They were standing in Star Labs, prepping to jump to Earth 38. Now that they were married and the invasion from Earth X has been quelled, they needed to get away from superheroing for a few days, and so Barry had decided to surprise Iris with the perfect honey moon location: A small Carribean island on Earth 38. It did not exist on their own Earth, making it a brand new experience for the duo. But more excitingly, it existed on a world without the Flash, where no one would expect him to show up and save the day. They would be 100% focused on relaxing.

Their plan was to use the portal device to jump to National City, as it was hard to estimate the coordinates of a location that didn't exist on their own Earth. From there, Barry could run them to their island getaway no problem.

"Don't worry, I'm all ready." Barry replied, smiling at his beautiful wife. He was almost as excited as she was to get away.

Without further hesitation, Iris pushed the button on the portal device, opening a breach.

"Have fun you two." Caitlin said, waving them goodbye.

"Don't worry, we'll hold down the fort until you're back." Ralph said, waving a comically elongated arm. Barry just laughed and shook his head as him and Iris walked into the breach.

The other side of the portal was unexpectedly dark. Barry felt the floor sink under his feet as he landed on an unexpectedly soft surface. Before he could figure out where he was, he heard a yelp from Iris.

"Iris! Iris where are you?" Barry shouted, his eyes not yet adjusted to sudden darkness.

"I'm down here Barry!" Iris shouted.

Barry realized he had landed on some sort of hill, whereas Iris had appeared just a little to the side and slid down it. He rushed over to the edge of the hill and looked down. He sighed with relief to see his wife standing below, on a flat white platform.

"Are you ok Iris?" Barry asked.

"I'd be better if you weren't standing on top of Kara's butt." Iris said, her unhappiness clear from her tone.

"Kara's butt? What are you talking about Iris?" Barry said, finally taking a minute to examine his surroundings. The squishy hill he had landed on was covered by thin pink fabric. Turning away from Iris, he saw a matching hill exactly the same size and shape as this one. When he looked down the hill to his right, he saw a long smooth descent, ending in a giant bare foot. "No way...." Barry said, turning in the other direction. But it was true: there, in the distance, was a giant sleeping Kara's head, laying sideways on a pillow. Iris was right, be was standing on Kara's giant butt, meaning he and Iris had somehow been shrunken by the portal device mid trip. "Sorry! Sorry! I didn't know where I was! I didn't even know we shrunk!" Barry shouted down to his new wife.

"Mhm...." Iris said, smiling now at her husband's embarrassment. "Maybe when we figure out how to grow back, I'll grow back first and you can try climbing on my butt. I promise you'll know exactly where you are then." Iris said with a wink.

Barry turned bright red at Iris's suggestion, shocked at how forward she was being. "Well, the important thing right now is to figure out how to grow back. Do you have the portal device? Maybe we could just teleport ourselves back to Earth 1?"

"Yeah I have it, but it doesn't seem to be working. Seems like it got fried on the way over here." Iris said.

Barry considered their options. "Ok, well then all we have to is to get Kara's attention, then she can help grow us back, either by bringing us to her friends or by giving us her portal device to use to get to Caitlin."

"You should probably get off her butt first, don't want the Girl of Steel thinking you were misbehaving." Iris said, and Barry blushed again.

"Right!" Barry said instantly, wanting to get out of this situation as soon as possible. He instinctively tried to speed down the giant butt cheek towards her face, but only managed to cause some tiny sparks as he ran at normal speed.

Iris could immediately tell something was wrong. "What's the problem Barry?"

"Not sure, my speed is not working the way I expect." Barry said. "I can still feel the speed force, but I can't really control it."

"Maybe the speed force is sort of calibrated based on your size?" Iris said.

"I guess that's possible." Barry said, trying and failing to vibrate his hand as he searched for control of his powers. After a minute, he gave up. "Don't worry about it Iris, we'll be back to normal size before we need to figure this out." He looked around for an alternative plan, knowing it would take awhile to get to Kara's head without his speed. He saw that there was a gap in her clothes where her pajama bottoms met her shirt, leaving the small of her back exposed. "I'm going to go try and get her attention from her back, I should be able to make her feel me from there." Barry said. He began to head down the slope of her butt, her pajama pants providing some much needed footholds that would have been missing from the smooth flesh of her rear. Iris continued to watch from her position on the mattress, next to Kara's tremendous ass. Finally, Barry arrived at the small of her back, hopping down off the waistband of her pajamas. "Sorry Kara." Barry muttered, before putting his hand down to her skin and forcing out a spark.

Kara stirred immediately, and Barry saw her giant manicured hand heading towards his position on her back. He sighted, relieved that she had felt him and sure they'd be back to normal size in no time.

What happens?

1. Kara feels Barry as an itch near her butt, and her scratching fingers drag him under her pajamas and panties and lodge him between her buns of steel. Iris is going to have to get Kara's attention on her own.

2. Kara sleepily knocks Barry off of her back, sending him falling down to the mattress after Iris.

3. Kara grabs Barry and picks him up to get a closer look at whatever is on her back, sitting up and on Iris in the process.

Nora decides to put this problem off by stuffing them inside her sneakers until she can fix the problem later.

053.title: Arrow S7 / Flash S5 /LOT S4 / Supergirl S4

0532.content:
"Is all of this really necessary?" Laurel asked, looking at pile of schematics on Felicity's table. "Diaz is just one guy."

"Yes, but he's one guy who could pay hundreds more, and he hates Oliver more than anyone. You and I are close seconds though."

"Alright fine, so what do you want me to do?" Laurel asked.

"I haven't tried the security system authorization process on anyone but Oliver William and I, so I'd like you to walk up to eye scanner here and let it ask who you are." Felicity explained.

"But I'm already inside your apartment." Laurel said, annoyed.

"I have scanners on every door that should function the same way as the one on the outside, so we can just do the test in here." Felicity said.

"Ugh, ok let's get this over with." Laurel said, approaching the device. Immediately, the robotic voice chimed in:

"Hello, please state your name and purpose."

"Uhhh, I'm Laurel Lance, and I'm here to visit Felicity." Laurel said. She looked to her blonde friend, who smiled and gave her two thumbs up.

The voice paused for a moment, before continuing: "Laurel Lance is dead. Imposter suspected. Scanning to determine true identity." A beam of light came out of the camera, scanning along Laurel's face.

"Uh, Felicity..." Laurel began, but was cut off but the security system. "Error, identified visitor as Laurel Lance, but cannot be Laurel Lance. Escalating to code red."

"Oh crap! I forgot to program this thing to know about doppelgangers. And I haven't tested code red at all yet...." Felicity said, tapping furiously at her tablet.

"Now intiating security protocol 53 Krypton." The robotic voice announced.

"What the hell is protocol Krypton?" Laurel asked.

"It's a last resort!" Felicity yelled. "It summons a hero from another Earth named Supergirl. Or it's supposed to anyway."

"Now initiating security protocol 27, Atom." The security system continued.

"Oh that's bad..." Felicity said, but before Laurel could ask why, a beam shot out of the wall and struck them both.

When the light faded, the two women were no longer in Felicity's apartment. Instead, they found themselves in another, wholly unfamiliar apartment that neither had ever been to. And more surprisingly, it was enormous.

"What the hell's going on Felicity?" Laurel asked, looking around the huge new apartment they found themselves in. "Where are we, and why is it so big?"

Felicity sighed, knowing full well what had happened, and not at all excited to tell Laurel about it. "It was the security system. Protocol Krypton opened a portal to Earth 38, but instead of summoning Kara to our Earth for help, it teleported us to Earth 38."

"And Earth 38 is full of giants?" Laurel asked.

"No, they're the same size as us. Well, the same size we normally are. Protocol Atom uses a shrink ray to miniaturize and neutralize potential threats."

Laurel's eyes widened with realization. "So we are tiny on a giant couch on another Earth? That's a goddamn phenomenal security system you've built Felicity. No one will ever be able to break in and hurt you because you'll get yourself killed first!" Laurel yelled.

"There are definitely still some kinks to work out..." Felicity admitted.

"Kinks! This is not a joke Felicity, we could be in serious danger here! We have to-"

CLACK, CLACK, CLACK

Laurel's yelling was interrupted by a rhythmic loud clacking noise, getting louder with every successive impact. The source of the noise was soon revealed, as a gigantic blonde woman walked into the room, dressed in a sweater, miniskirt, and heels.

"Who is that?" Laurel asked, trying to hide the fear in her voice. The giantess didn't look threatening, but her enormous size meant she could easily annihilate the tiny women under her heels.

"That's Supergirl, one of this Earth's most powerful heroes." Felicity explained. "Her regular name is Kara though. She is super nice, I'm sure she will help us if we just explain what happened."

"She's a superhero?" Laurel asked skeptically. "She doesn't look like she could hurt a fly."

"Trust me, she is stronger than she looks." Felicity replied. "Now we just have to get her attention."

"Let me try." Laurel said, and before Felicity could cover her ears Laurel let out one of her signature canary cries. Felicity found it as deafening as always, but Kara didn't even blink, continuing to go about her routine by kicking off her shoes and placing her bag in her bedroom.

"Is that girl deaf?" Laurel asked.

"No, but I might be now." Felicity replied loudly, ears still ringing from the deafening sound. "She actually has excellent hearing, she has to actively work to ignore all the random conversations happening around her. I think at our new size your canary cry is just too high pitched to hear."

Kara reentered the room, this time heading towards the tiny girls. Felicity jumped and waved, calling out to her giant friend. "Kara! Kara!" Kara's eyes were clearly scanning the room for something, and they seemed to lock right onto the tiny woman. "Oh Kara, I'm so glad you saw us...." Felicity to began, only to have her hopes dashed as Kara grabbed the TV remote off the coffee table just in front of them. With the push of a button, the TV was on, and the noise from that drowned out any yelling they could possibly do.

"Now what?" Laurel asked.

"Butt!" Felicity stammered, pointing up past Laurel. The tiny canary turned around to see what Felicity was pointing to, and just as she said, there was a giant ass hanging over them, blocking out the light like an eclipse. As Kara flipped up her skirt, the tiny girls got a good look at a pair of enormous pale butt cheeks, wrapped in a pair of pink panties. And then those cheeks were speeding down towards the couch.

Each one of the tiny girls took the brunt of a different cheek. Felicity was pinned right in the center of her left butt cheek, her face buried in the soft skin of the Kryptonian rear end, whereas Laurel was fortunate enough to have an admittedly thin pair of panties separating her from the world's strongest woman.

Felicity tried to wiggle free, hoping she could slide out from under the giant cheek and get her friend's attention. This quickly proved hopeless though. The usually light Kara was far too heavy for Felicity to shift even an inch, and as she sunk into the soft butt flesh bearing down on her, every possible route of escape she could take was blocked by impenetrable skin. All she could do was hope she'd be felt.

Laurel made no attempt to escape. Given the choice between fight or flight, she had chosen fight, and was actively attacking the ass that was pressing down on her, scratching and kicking with what little freedom she had to move her limbs. What Laurel didn't realize was that to a Kryptonian, these strikes were effectively nonexistant. Kara couldn't feel a thing as she settled into the couch, excited to see she was just in time to catch the beginning of her favorite show.

The tiny duo spent 15 minutes struggling, sure that any second would be the one where Kara wondered what was squirming under her butt and found them. But it was becoming increasingly clear that Kara was not going to notice them, and they could easily spend all evening as cushions. Frustrated, Laurel let loose another canary cry, point blank against the giant butt. It didn't so much as make a ripple in her incredibly strong skin. In fact, Kara thought it was just a draft.

"Oooh, a little drafty in here." Kara mumbled. "I should get my PJs on." Not wanting to miss a second of her show, she sped away at lightning speed, carrying Felicity with her.

"Felicity!" Laurel yelled, but she had vanished, stuck to the giant Kryptonian butt cheek when Kara had rushed away. And then, as fast as it had disappeared, the giant Kryptonian's butt was back, this time covered by a pair of flannel pajama pants. "Not again!" Laurel yelled in frustration, just in time for a now pajama clad ass to slam down on top of her, once again pinning her under a butt cheek.

Felicity was even more overwhelmed. She had been dragged away when Kara stood up, felt a brief gust of wind as Kara removed her skirt and panties, and then she found herself in the dark. Then the avalanche of ass came down on her as Kara sat down. As Kara's butt flesh settled down on her again, she realized what had happened: Kara had changed into pajama pants at super speed, and she was now trapped inside them.

Kara smiled, happy she hadn't missed anything important. She shifted a little to one side, dragging her butt along the couch as she did so. This do much more than annoy Laurel, who hated having this giant girl unknowingly rub her butt across her face. But for Felicity, it meant sliding away from the relative safety of Kara's gigantic butt cheek and towards Kara's crack. She was now looking up into the dark depths of Kara's butt, saved only by her left arm which remained pinned under Kara's left cheek.

"Laurel! Help me! I'm going to get pulled inside!" Felicity screamed, her shrill cry reaching Laurel's ears despite the ample butt flesh in between them. Laurel was unnerved by the fear in her friend's voice. Felicity wasn't very strong, but she didn't scare easily, so she could only imagine what was going on inside those pants.

"Don't worry Felicity! I'll get you out of there!" Laurel yelled, not sure how she could possibly do so.

What happens next?

1. Alex arrives at the apartment, and Kara scoots over to make room for her sister, allowing Alex to sit on Laurel.

2. Kara puts her feet up and makes herself comfortable, drawing Laurel under her butt crack and Felicity deeper into her butt.

3. Kara finishes watching TV and heads into the kitchen to make herself dinner, with Felicity along for the ride.
0532.title: Secured Beneath Kara's Cheeks

055132.content:
Sara and Barry couldn't help but cry as they watched Oliver die for the second time. He may have been the Spectre now, but to them he was still the friend and hero who they had known for years. He had been an inspiration to them both, and now he was gone for good. Pulling themselves together, they walked solemnly back towards the remaining Paragons, rejoining their exhausted comrades.

"I can't believe he's really gone." Barry said.

"He seemed like a good man. And he died an honorable death." Kate said solemnly.

"Yeah yeah quit it with the waterworks." Lex cut in, annoyed at the outpouring of emotion for this man he didn't even know.

"Can it Lex." Kara said. "Oliver was twice the man you'll ever be."

"It's true, Ollie was a great man. He died fighting for us to have a new world, now we have to protect it." Sara said, turning to face the blackness off the edge of the platform that was the Dawn of Time. In the distance, she could see a tiny speck forming, the seed of the new world that Oliver had died for. In this new world, anything was possible. They knew it would be similar to their own, but anything could change. As Barry saw the brightness of the explosion, he wished he could just be close to Iris again. Sara was thinking of how hard it must be for Felicity with no one to support her now that Oliver was gone. And Kara was thinking of how much she missed her sister Alex. None of them knew what this new universe had in store as it exploded with a boom, beginning to rapidly expand. They were witnessing the Big Bang in person.

Unfortunately for them, as the universe suddenly expanded around them and time began to race forward, space and time were not quite in sync by the time they reached the 7 paragons. The universe grew much faster than the paragons could hope to keep up with, and they were whisked away in the incoming wave of matter, unsure what to expect on the other side. They certainly didn't expect to wake up:

1. 1 millimeter tall, on top of a recliner in Felicity's new apartment in Star City where she is raising her and Oliver's Daughter Mia, just as she enters the room. Kara being the only one able to fly, escape's Felicity's falling bum when she goes to sit down and must somehow get her attention whilst no bigger than a gnat.

2. 1 centimeter tall, on the floor in Alex' apartment, just as her girlfriend Kelly returns from grocery shopping, taking it upon herself to do some exterminating, causing the Paragon's to flee, using their unique abilities to avoid being crushed by the gigantic woman before Alex comes to their rescue, interrupting Kelly mid-stomp after she corners one of the supposed bugs.

3. 1 inch tall, scattered throughout the apartment of a giant Iris as she was getting ready for work. This first chapter would focus on J'onn and Sara being trapped under her feet in her slippers and Lex being devoured as a piece of granola in her yogurt.

She spends her time as Supergirl collaborating with her sister Alex Danvers at the DEO, a secret organization that tracks down and captures rouge super-powered aliens.

11131.title: Supergirl Season 1: Kara Shrinks?

111311.content:
Kara Danvers, alias Supergirl, hurried into the office building where she worked, carrying a coffee in a cardboard tray. She walked into her boss's room and set the tray down on the desk. The lights were on in the skyscraper, but she was the only one on the floor right now. That would change sooner or later, she knew. One the few powers that she could use relatively freely was her x-ray vision, and with it she had seen some of her coworkers taking the elevator on the way up. But given that her boss -- the one and only Cat Grant -- had a tendency to arrive fashionably late, there was probably plenty of time to laze around before she arrived. While Supergirl was very publicly a hard and dedicated worker, Kara Danvers was practically invisible, a fixture in the office-place. As long as she was standing at attention at the proper spot when the boss arrived, and as long as she didn't break or steal anything, she had free reign of the office in the small hours. And so Supergirl turned her attention to the office.

It was a rather aesthetically-pleasing sort of office -- with lots and lots of white. A couple of white lamps with white lampshades rested on the white desk (one on a white platform above the white desk), while on the opposite end there was a white vase filled with white flowers. In the middle was a white laptop, and behind the desk was a white wainscot. The rest of the room was painted in a dull shade of white. Practically the only bits of color in the whole room were the chairs and the televisions, which were turned off. However, as Supergirl walked closer to the television screens, she could just barely make out a faint red glow on the wall immediately underneath one of the sets. Whatever it was, it wasn't there before today. The Kryptonian tried to see what it was by pressing her face against the space of wall between the televisions, but the source of the red glow appeared to be on the back rim of the screen itself. Without really thinking about it, Kara went over to the offending television set and wedged her hand between the wall and the screen to see if she could remove the source of the red light.

Her fingers brushed against something sticky. A burning wave passed through her body, and it suddenly felt like every fiber of her was on fire. She withdrew her hand, and saw the glowing, reddish substance coating her fingertips. It had a viscosity vaguely like Jell-O, and had little flecks of what might have been some sort of stone sprinkled and suspended in the bright jelly. And it was incredibly painful for her to hold. It must be some form of Kryptonite, or possibly some other kind of radioactive substance. But what was it doing here? Who put it there? Why? Kara's mind reeled with questions whose answers wouldn't help now. The office began to swim in her now-blurry vision. The desk and everything in it started to spin in a confusing, disorienting, blinding whirlwind. Flash after flash of bright white light dazzled her eyes. Kara blinked and shook her head. She could barely keep her balance in her dizziness. Her legs turned to jelly, her knees buckled, and she pitched forward. She came to a sudden stop on something soft, a great big brown lump in the midst of all this madness. A big brown lump that was growing bigger and bigger by the second. Kara, with the last coherent bits of her brain, tried to rally and crawled on to the brown mass. Then her vision was eaten away at the corners and she fell against the seat of the chair, finally unconscious.

***

When Kara woke up, her first sight was of her curled legs, which she was hugging tightly. She slowly relaxed her muscles and extended her legs, getting out of the fetal position that she had unawaredly gotten herself into. Then she took stock of her surroundings. It looked like she was in a much, much larger version of Cat's office. Then she heard the elevator ding, and the general hubbub of people storming in, but at a magnified scale. She had shrunk!

Then she heard another sound; a massive BEEP, and then metal doors sliding open. Stylish high heels clacked on the floor, the noise getting louder as the giantess got closer; it was Cat Grant, Kara's boss, about to sit in the chair Kara was stuck on. Realizing her situation, the tiny Kryptonian got unsteadily to her feet and jumped upwards in an attempt to fly off. But instead of achieving liftoff, she fell right back down onto the fabric. She bounced once, twice, and then when she flopped down on it for a third time, the thick fabric of the chair embraced her, swaying in a motion too small to be perceived by the naked eye. Cat Grant was very close now. Kara quickly scrambled to an upright position, but she could do nothing. That... gunk... must have not only shrunk her, but also taken away some of her powers -- if not all of them, at least her flight. And unfortunately for Kara, the ability to fly was perhaps the one thing she needed the most right now.

Cat Grant pulled out the chair, took a quick step forward, and sat down. Kara did not scream as she saw the looming hindquarters of her boss suddenly twist above her before they plummeted downwards with her at ground zero on the brown chair. Instead, she fell back flat against the cushion, hoping most of the weight would be transferred to the seat instead of directly on Kara's head...

WHUMP!

When the diminutive Kara woke up, she found herself forced deeper into the small depression that she had made in the seat. Her boss's rear was slowly pressing down on her, but the pressure was evenly distributed across the chair. There was even just enough room for Kara to breathe. After she had gotten over the shock of just where she was, the shrunken Supergirl began banging her fists on Cat Grant's behind. But the affluent journalist gave no sign that she felt the barrage, if she even felt it all. Eventually, Kara had exhausted herself pummeling at her boss's gigantic rear. She slumped down further, defeated. Then it was Cat's turn. The unaware giantess began to shift and squirm minutely in her chair. The motion would be imperceptible to most onlookers, and was almost that way for Cat, but for Kara it seemed as though an entire third of what she could see suddenly slid along the fabric of the chair, making a light skidding sound in the process that to the shrunken Kryptonian was a deafening roar.

Then Cat shifted in the other direction, and the loud, grating screech of fabric on fabric came back. Kara noticed that as her boss's immense rear returned and slid to the other side, it clipped the edges of Kara's little refuge, taking a small portion of the indentation and smoothing it out, forcing Kara ever so slightly closer to the crushing force of Cat Grant's behind. Then the giantess repeated the motion, and Supergirl came closer. And closer. And closer... Kara was now mere millimeters from the shifting, squirming mass. Any closer and she'd be in the blast zone. Shuddering at what she was about to do, Kara placed her hand firmly on her boss's behind and shoved with all her might. The tiny Kryptonian groaned and strained with effort. Miniscule beads of sweat started to form on her miniaturized body. She put her all into one enormous push...

Cat Grant, for the time span of about five seconds, was about an inch taller than usual, but she didn't consciously notice this seemingly-inexplicable feat. Instead, she felt like there was another, more pronounced lump in the center of her chair. To combat this, she gripped the edge of her seat in both hands and used them as leverage as she settled her rear further back in the soft brown fabric of the cushion. Even with her entire weight on top of the one miniscule speck, the lump managed to resist for several seconds before collapsing inwards along the line of the chair. Cat Grant wiggled a little just to make sure that it was gone, and crossed her legs. A brief thought flickered in her mind about that lump -- she'd have to check that chair eventually to make sure that there were not going to be any more of those pesky lumps in the future. The rich girl and unaware giantess shook her head almost imperceptibly, making a mental note to call for a repairman later, then disregarded all further thoughts about the lump. She scooted forward about an inch, leaned towards the desk, and set about her work.

Kara was defeated. Even though she still apparently had a measure of her superpowers left, what was left had been scaled down and was now useless to her, now that she was firmly embedded in the crater of her own boss's behind with neither escape nor respite in the foreseeable future. But that wasn't going to stop her from trying. Futilely, pathetically, the shrunken Kryptonian crawled forward, dragging herself slowly in a direction that she could only hope led to "out", knowing that if Cat even so much as leaned back she would be trapped. And so she inched along with quiet desperation, fervently wishing the wealthy woman would sit still for just a few minutes more...

However, far above, the aforementioned woman was in fact feeling slightly uncomfortable. Possibly it was that lump she had felt before. But it would undignified for her to stand up and squat at her desk just because she was feeling a little discomfort, especially since -- despite her best efforts -- anyone on the level could walk right into her office. She should just ignore the lump, and focus on her work. But on the other hand the lump really was beginning to bother her, and one small check couldn't hurt, right? The most powerful women in National City continued shifting in her chair, uncrossing her legs as she thought about the dilemma for a few seconds, eyes staring off into space. Then, as her mind gravitated back to Earth, she decided on a course of action.

What would she do?

1. Cat continues sitting on the chair and Kara as she fulfills her duties as CEO.

2. Cat feels something moving under her and finds Kara, deciding to reassign her to a new job.
111311.title: Kryptonian Seat Cushion

Season 2 of Supergirl has Kara meet Mon El, a Daxamite who she attempts to train to be a hero and eventually falls in love with. Queen Rhea, Mon El's mother, is the primary villain of the season. Season 2 also introduces Alex's love interest Maggie and begins James's career as the Guardian.

With all this in mind, who shrinks?
112.title: Supergirl Season 2: Who Shrinks?

choices: Kara Teaches Mon El a Big Lesson
Alone and Unknown in Kara's Apartment
1121.content:
What's the situation?

1. Angry at Mon El for keeping his secret from her, Kara decides to teach her boyfriend a lesson by shrinking him down and keeping him with and under her at all times.

2. Mon El shrinks alone in Kara's apartment while Kara is at work at CatCo.
1121.title: Supergirl Season 2: Mon El Shrinks

11211.content:
When Mon El awoke, he found himself in an unfamiliar environment. The last thing he remembered was approaching Kara at the DEO, wanting to speak to her about what had transpired between them. The memory ended abruptly with a sudden flash of light, after which he must have passed out. Now he was laying on a warm pale surface. Wherever he was, he could tell Kara must be there too somewhere, as he could smell the familiar scent of her body lotion nearby.

"Looks like you're finally awake little prince." Boomed a familiar voice from above. Looking up towards it, Mon El found himself staring into a pair of gigantic blue eyes belonging to none other than Kara herself. Somehow, her face was now massive, taking up most of his field of view. And the pale surface he was standing on was her open hand, fingers unfurled to make a sort of platform. Somehow, he had shrunken. "How'd you sleep?" Kara inquired, a playful smile on her face.

Mon El guessed by Kara's lack of reaction to his predicament that she was not at all surprised by his new stature. "What happened to me Kara? How did I get so small?"

"That's an easy one Mon El. I shrunk you." Kara said, letting out a little giggle at Mon El's look of shock. "I decided that you needed to be taught a lesson, and I'm going to be the one to teach it to you. You lied to me about who you are and where you came from, and despite being here for months, you never told me the truth. I'm supposed to be your girlfriend Mon El. We are supposed to tell each other everything."

Mon El knew she was right, and bowed his head in shame. However, that did not clarify why exactly he was tiny. "I know what I did was wrong Kara! But why shrink me? How does that accomplish anything?"

"That's an easy one little guy. That lesson I mentioned earlier? I'm going to teach you how to be a supportive boyfriend. And the way I'm going to do that is by making you support me for a while." Kara said with a knowing smirk.

"What do you mean by support you?" Mon El asked anxiously, not sure he would like the response.

"Good question Mon El. In general, I basically mean doing whatever I ask you to do for as long as you're tiny. But for right now, I mean you'll be supporting my weight by acting as the insole of my right boot."

"You can't be serious Kara!" Mon El yelled, looking nervously down into the gigantic red boot below. "You're going to crush me!"

"Don't be such a baby Mon-El. You and I both know that it'll take more than my foot to crush a Daxamite like yourself. You'll be fine." Kara said, dangling her tiny boyfriend over the entrance to the boot. "Of course, if I decide I like having you in there and keep you down there for a while, I'll have to be sure to take you out once a week or so, that way you get some sun. Wouldn't want your little solar battery to run dry." Kara teased, having no intention of doing anything that cruel. After all, angry or not, she was still Supergirl.

Before Mon El could object further, Kara released her grip on her tiny boyfriend, sending him careening downwards into the gigantic red boot.

"Consider this a first step in learning to be a supportive boyfriend." Kara teased, wiggling her toes tauntingly over the entrance to the boot. "Sure, you'll just be supporting my foot, but that's a pretty good start."

Mon-El's shouting went ignored as his view of Kara's face disappeared entirely, replaced only with a rapidly approaching foot. His girlfriend's well pedicured toes slid gracefully downward into the boot, before turning to move forward towards the shrunken prince. He realized he ought to start running away as the 5 monstrous toes charged towards him, but he did so too late to make it to the toe of her boot in time. Instead, her gigantic toes effortlessly plowed through him, knocking him flat on his face as they sailed past him, leaving behind nothing but the endless pale wall of Kara's sole. It hung over him for a moment, taunting him with the knowledge of what was coming next. Then without any warning, it descended, pinning the tiny prince beneath the ball of his girlfriend's foot.

"Mmmm.... You actually feel pretty nice under there Mon-El. You might not be much of a boyfriend or a hero, but you have the makings of a wonderful insole." Kara said with a smile, very much appreciating the power she felt over miniature Mon El.

Of course, Mon El had no idea she was smiling, and could only barely make out what she was saying. All of his senses were completely and totally overwhelmed by one thing and one thing only, Kara's foot. His face was buried in the ball of her foot, which was already coated in a thin sheen of sweat after a day cooped up in the heroine's signature red boots. Boots of which he was now an unwilling occupant. He tried to pull his face away, but there was nowhere for it to go. Behind his head was the well worn insole of his girlfriend's shoes, and in front there was nothing but the sweaty foot flesh of National City's superhero, pressing into his tiny body with unrelenting force.

"Of course, these boots were made for walking though." Kara said, lifting her foot into the air slowly, wanting to savor her first step. For the tiny Mon El, he felt like he was on a roller-coaster that was slowly rising towards a peak, well aware that the relative calm was about to suddenly end. Her foot was no longer pressed against his face, giving him about a centimeter of air between him and sweaty Kryptonian feet. But then the foot began to descend, and the force of its descent pressed his face into his girlfriend's sole.

SLAP

Her foot struck the ground with a slap, smacking his back down into the sole of the boot once more as the avalanche of foot flesh overtakes him, her soft sole flowing around and enveloping him in foot flesh. His sense of smell was overwhelmed by the combination of sweaty feet and Kara's foot lotion, his sense of touch taken over by sweaty foot flesh pressed against every inch of his skin.

And this was only the first of many steps. As Kara lifted her other foot, this put all of her weight on the foot Mon El was supporting, truly making him feel like he was going to be squished into the sole of the red boot. But before he met it, the foot he was under was the one being lifted, just to be slammed down once more.

And so Kara continued to walk, taking a short break only to get in the elevator and ride up to the DEO roof. When she got there and was once again alone (other than her tiny boyfriend turned foot cushion), she spoke to Mon El: "You're doing great so far Mon El. I think this is going to be the beginning of a wonderful arrangement. Unfortunately, I can't do my patrol on foot."

Mon El gasped with relief as Kara's weight suddenly lifted off of him. He thought she was taking her boots off, but in fact she was the one taking off. She was now flying through the air, leaving the tiny Mon El in the strange situation of laying atop her now upside down sole. It was far from paradise, but the tiny Daxamite sighed with relief now that he could finally breathe.

That is, until Kara spotted a bank robbery in progress on the street below. She was hundreds of feet in the air, but her super vision allowed her to see things going on on the ground with bear perfect clarity. Smiling at the chance to get some action in, Kara began a speedy descent, turning her feet towards the ground to prepare for impact.

Her landing struck Mon El like a freight train. When Kara landed quickly enough, it often left boot marks in concrete. This time was no different, except that Mon El was there to feel the brunt of the collision. Her foot drove his head backwards into the dingy sole of the boot so hard that he instantly was knocked unconscious.

Though Kara was upset when she felt her little boyfriend pass out, she really couldn't blame him. It was his first day as an insole after all, and he was trapped under the sole of the most powerful girl on Earth. It would take time for him to get used to that. Ignoring him for now, she put on a stern face for the bank robbers who were now quivering in fear before her and began to advance towards them. They'd be going to prison for a long time, but Mon El would have traded places with them in a heart beat. He couldn't imagine a worse prison than Kara's boot. Unfortunately for him, Kara still had a few other ideas in mind for him....

When Mon El awoke, where did he find himself?

1. Still trapped beneath Kara's foot, but now in one of her heels while she works at Catco.

2. On the coffee table in Kara's apartment, sitting before a pajama clad Kara and Alex who were about to begin girls night (maybe they sit on him during a movie, make him avoid getting eaten with their popcorn, play some kind of dare game with him, etc.)

3. Frozen in an ice cube so that only his head was sticking out, and floating in Kara's drink at the alien bar.

112113.content:
Mon-El woke up familiarly, rubbing his swollen forehead as he reminded himself of the situation at hand. He remembered being shrunk by Kara, dropped inside the superheroine's iconic red boots before he mysteriously passed out. Now, hours later, he finds himself contained within a type of glass room. Surrounded by some form of liquid, wondering whether or not Kara had returned him to normal.

"Would you look at that, look who finally decided to wake up! What took you so long, little guy?" Boomed the familiar voice of Kara Danvers, sounding different than before, her voice was higher, and she seemed to be slurring her words. Almost like she was drunk or something.

"Great, just what I need," Mon-El mumbles to himself before he felt a shiver run down his spine, wondering why the room was so cold. "Kara, can't we talk about this? Face to face?" Mon-El asked, rubbing his hands together for warmth, able to see a blue wall in front of him.

"Okay, little guy. But, you do realize my eyes are up here, so you can stop staring at my boobs." Kara laughed, forcing Mon-El's gaze upwards to the sight of a gigantic Kara Zor El childishly laughing at him. Her size more than doubling since he'd last laid eyes on her, shrinking Mon-El to the tiny size of 1 centimeter tall to help alleviate her boredom.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-jvSDj-F...

What's more, he found himself floating inside of a glass of Aldebaran Rum, over ice, the only drink Kara has ever been able to get drunk off. And somehow, she'd managed to trap him inside one of her ice cubes. Judging by the looks of the table and her relaxed demeanor, it was safe to say it wasn't her first glass of the night. Able to spot three more glassed to te giantess alien's right side, all emptied of their contents to the last drop.

"What the hell? Kara? How did you even do this?" Mon-El asked, banging on the ice cube to try and breakthrough to the other side. His fists not even able to crack the ice as Kara leaned in to watch the show, giggling childishly at the shrunken Daxamite in his newest cage.

"Awe, you're so little and cute." Kara teased, folding her arms over one another and resting her chin on her wrists to look Mon-El in the eye? His vision of her face distorted by a mix of the glass, ice, and alcohol between them, making her out to look like an enormous monster.

"No need to look so scared, I won't hurt you. Much." Kara laughed, flashing her pearly white teeth, and banging on the table, cautiously holding back her immense strength. Still, the force of the impact was more than strong enough to shake things up for Mon-El as the ice cubes clacked against one another.

Kara then straightened herself out, sitting up tall over the table before she wrapped her fingers around the glass. Tilting Mon-El's entire world view as she lifted the glass off the table, continuing to enjoy her night out.

"Kara, what on Daxam are you doing?" he asked, as Kara motioned him towards her pink lips.

"Jeez, can't a girl have a drink around here without being questioned?" Kara giggled, puckering her lips before taking a sip from the glass. Mon-El, stumbling inside of the heaviest ice cube, was carried by the current towards Kara's waiting mouth. Through his eyes, gallons then barrels worth of alcohol disappeared down the blonde Kyptonian's throat as he followed it up to her teeth.

She caught him between her lips, allowing him to watch as more alcohol rushed passed his cubicle prison, able to see inside her mouth as the warmth of her lips began to melt the ice around him. Fear creeping in as he imagined himself being eaten alive by his giant girlfriend. "Kara, please let me out!" he yelled, not wanting to be swallowed whole.

She didn't help the situation any by opening her mouth wide enough for the cube to pass through her lips, breathing outwards, and fogging Mon-El's field of vision as her hot breath began to melt the surface of his jail. Even with his vision distorted, the tiny alien had a near-perfect view of the giantess's teeth and long pink tongue, with her uvula twitching at the back of her cavern-like mouth, almost like it was waving at him.

All it would take was just one push, a simple movement from Kara's wrist, and Mon-El would disappear inside her mouth. Never to be seen again. She could crack the thin barrier of ice protecting the miniature man by shattering it between her teeth or using her tongue to smash him against the pearly white pillars. But she just giggled as the last drop of alcohol slid down her throat, taunting the diminutive Daxamite with a *gulp* followed by a sharp exhale.

Kara then leveled her glass, allowing Mon-El to fall beneath the surface of her drink. "Someone seems a little cranky, why don't you take a timeout, little guy? Maybe at the bottom of the glass." Kara said firmly, her demeanor changing after Mon-El's screams disrupted her good mood.

She reached for a straw M'Gann had left out for her, peeling off the wrapper and crumpling it into a ball before tossing it off to the side next to her glass. Leading Mon-El to wonder what Kara meant exactly, watching eagerly from below as Kara held the straw between her fingertips, pointing it in his direction.

Mon-El looked up puzzled, wondering what Kara meant by the word "timeout," and what she planned on doing with the plastic straw. The answer quickly came to him as she abruptly thrusts the tip towards him, piercing the ice he couldn't even crack like a mighty spear. The tiny Daxamite fleed into a corner to avoid being hit, the straw landing in front of him with a base large enough for him to squeeze through.

With her powerful lungs, Kara could create a vacuum and suck Mon-El out of the cube with the intensive force of a hurricane, which would allow him to travel straight passed her mouth and right down her esophagus with minimal effort. However, Kara's goal wasn't to harm her shrunken boyfriend, playfully pursing her lips around the opposite end of the straw and blowing a steady air current into the tunnel.

Unlike Mon-El, the Kryptonian woman had spent most of her life learning to control and restrain her otherworldly abilities, able to use the perfect amount of force even while she was inebriated. Her warm alcohol-infused breath whipped Mon-El along the frozen walls of his ice cube prison, sending him into a spiral as the pressure built up.

Inevitably, it became too much, and the ice shot from the tip of Kara's straw, sentencing him to the depths of the alcoholic beverage. Air bubbles rose to the top of her glass while Mon-El's container began to take on the alien brand Rum, weighing him down as it bounced off the curved glass, realizing he might drown it Kara didn't save him soon.

However, that outcome didn't appear likely as she laughed hysterically inside her booth, slapping her knee. Finding great satisfaction in Mon-El's torment, a quality that wasn't usually present in her personality, attributing it to the alcohol, and the fact that Kara was a lightweight, despite her resistance to Earth's alcohol.

*clink, clink, clink*

Mon-El bounced off the glass over and over again on the way down, all while alcohol rushed into the cube, weighing it down. Luckily, as the liquids rose to chest level Mon-El capsized, landing upside down and sealing the breach. Giving him some much-needed room to breathe as Kara calmed down, resting her chest against the table as she inserted her straw into her drink. Purposely dropping it in front of her shrunken boyfriend.

He could see the currents rush to her straw, as Kara intentionally ignored him, sipping quietly on her drink while Mon-El stayed silent. The ice above him slowly getting lower and lower as the minutes passed, making him feel as if the sky was falling on top of him. At the same time, his field of vision clear to reveal more of the bar. It was late, and the place was nearly empty, signaling that Kara was heading towards last call.

She sucked her drink dry, down to the last drop, but Kara continued sucking on her straw, trying to pull out more. She leaned back before releasing a powerful burp, shaking the table and drawing the attention of the other patrons.

"Burrrp! Excuse me." Kara laughed, before turning her attention back to Mon-El, reaching down the glass and fishing out the ice cube he was inside. "Now, whhat shhould I dooo with youu littlle-hiccup, little guy?" Kara asked, slurring her words as she rolled Mon-El between her fingertips to examine him.

Mon-El froze, he realized the glass, liquor, and ice had distorted his vision of Kara, making her appear differently, but she was just as big now as she was before. Probably clearing over a thousand feet tall standing upright.

What will Kara do next?

1. Kara tells Mon-El that she's going to "carefully" break him out between her teeth, allowing him to spill out onto her tongue. But, after freeing him, and tasting the excess alcohol, will Kara be able to stop herself from sucking him dry, or will she accidentally send him on a trip to her stomach?

2. While talking down to Mon-El, he slips through the hole in the ice, landing on the table in front of Kara. She wouldn't notice right away, giving Mon-El a chance to escape, but will it become more difficult once Kara notices him in front of her?

3. Kara begins to feel bad seeing Mon-el as he shivers inside the ice, offing to warm him up herself by tilting the ice cube towards herself and letting Mon-El fall through the hole she made earlier, landing between her tits. The massive orbs stopping his fall and serving as a means to silence his screams as she gets up to pay her bill and leave.

How will James Shrink?
